title: PHPstrtr()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPstrtr()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Replace the characters "ia" in the string with "eo":
<?php
echo strtr("Hilla Warld","ia","eo");
?>

Definition and Usage
The strtr() function translates certain characters in a string.
Note:
If the from and to parameters are different in length, both will be formatted to 
the length of the shortest.
Syntax
strtr(
string,from,to
)
or
strtr(
string,array
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. Specifies the string to translate
from
Required (unless array is used). Specifies what characters to change
to
Required (unless array is used). Specifies what characters to change into
array
Required (unless to and from is used). An array containing what to change from as key, and what to change to as value
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the translated string.
If the
array
parameter contains a key which is an empty string (""), it will return FALSE.
PHP Version:
4+
More Examples
Example
Replace the string "Hello world" with "Hi earth":
<?php
$arr = array("Hello" => "Hi", "world" => "earth");
echo strtr("Hello world",$arr);
?>

★
+1

quiz.question: What is If the from and to parameters?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of If the from and to parameters is 'different in length'.

quiz.question: What is unless array?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of unless array is 'used)'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPstrtr()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPstrtr()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPstrtr()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
